comments.body:
```suggestion
      default: 1
```

I added an `example` instead of a `default` so that `worker_prefetch_multiplier` was commented out after running `pre_commit_yaml_to_cfg.py` to generate `default_airflow.cfg`.  With a `default` the setting is not commented out.

comments.body:
We could actually add the default here, so that users can easily override it.

```suggestion
      default: Airflow
```
Thoughts here @pcandoalmeida ?
Hiya @kaxil sorry didn't see this! Yes, this defaults the page title to Airflow. By default, we have `Airflow - Airflow` unless there is a specific instance name like `Airflow - Dev`.

comments.body:
```suggestion
        The maximum number of task instances allowed to run concurrently across the DAG Runs for that
```
It appears the behaviour is across the DagRuns for that DAG. Wrong implementation? I checked by setting the dag_concurrency to 5 and triggered the dag multiple times. Only 5 tasks run across the DagRuns at a time and the log message is saying DAG's `task concurrency`( a bit confusing) 
```
[2021-05-30 06:28:06,727] {scheduler_job.py:1025} INFO - DAG example_bash_operator has 5/5 running and queued tasks
[2021-05-30 06:28:06,727] {scheduler_job.py:1033} INFO - Not executing <TaskInstance: example_bash_operator.also_run_this 2021-05-30 06:26:58.716604+00:00 [scheduled]> since the number of tasks running or queued from DAG example_bash_operator is >= to the DAG's task concurrency limit of 5
```

That line is coming after `task_concurrency` check, are you sure you haven't set `task_concurency`. I am on leave on June 1, will be back on June 2 -- can take a look at your DAG together:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/eb85c9d191e452aab596333b9e82d3a9e6428542/airflow/jobs/scheduler_job.py#L1047-L1058
Ok. When you're back.
